sentences.en: " It's Hollywood, " Bryant said with unabashed glee. " It's a movie script. "
sentences.cn: “ 这里就像好莱坞一样, ” 科比毫不掩饰的笑着说道. “ 一切都像电影的剧本一样. ”

sentences.en: At the least encouragement out would come my manuscript book, unabashed.
sentences.cn: 他只要稍微表示出鼓励的意思,我就毫不害羞地把草稿本拿出来.

sentences.en: But she's an unabashed fan of the phenomenon.
sentences.cn: 然而,里奥利却对这种现象非常着迷.

sentences.en: Champagne typical in its brilliance of color, meticulous rendering of detail, compact composition, and unabashed abundance.
sentences.cn: 香槟酒具有独特的色泽 、 一丝不苟的细节 、 紧凑的构成和不加掩饰的丰富.

sentences.en: Eg : Stephen an unabashed hedonist, indulging his urges with lavish meals and multiple sexual partners.
sentences.cn: 史蒂芬 是个不知羞耻的享乐主义者,沉溺于大吃大喝和滥交中.

sentences.en: He is thick - skinned , and unabashed to whatever you may say.
sentences.cn: 他脸厚不害臊,你随便骂.

sentences.en: He seems unabashed by his recent defeat.
sentences.cn: 他似乎对最近的失利并不在乎。

sentences.en: His trousers fell down but he appeared quite unabashed.
sentences.cn: 他的裤子掉了下来,可他却显得满不在乎.

sentences.en: Lydia was Lydia still untamed , unabashed, wild , noisy, and fearless.
sentences.cn: 丽迪雅还是丽迪雅──不安分,不害羞, 撒野吵嚷, 天不怕地不怕的.

sentences.en: Marilyn Monroe captivated the world with her beauty, glamour, and unabashed sex appeal.
sentences.cn: 玛丽莲梦露用她的美丽, 魔魅和毫不加以掩饰的性感征服了整个世界.

sentences.en: No, it's an unabashed, simple old - time message in English:'Merry Christmas & Happy New Year.
sentences.cn: 都不是, 贺卡上只写了一句简单的老套英语祝福: 恭祝圣诞 及 新年快乐.

sentences.en: She stared at him with unabashed curiosity.
sentences.cn: 她好奇地盯着他看，一点也不难为情。

sentences.en: She stared unabashed curiosity at the empty pants that once contained my legs.
sentences.cn: 她不害羞而好奇地直盯著我那曾经包裹双腿的空洞裤管.

sentences.en: Tim appeared unabashed by all the media attention.
sentences.cn: 蒂姆成了传播媒介的焦点,却也满不在乎.

sentences.en: Unabashed by his rejection, Mr. Collins proposes again, but finally concedes defeat.
sentences.cn: 遭拒绝后, 柯林斯先生并不感到羞愧,再次求婚, 但最终不得不自认失败.

words.tran_cn: 不害羞的；不畏惧的；厚脸皮的

trans.tran_cn: 不害臊的，不怕羞的，满不在乎的，不加掩饰的
trans.tran_en: not ashamed or embarrassed, especially when doing something unusual or rude
